She told us there were liberals living n.content: She told us there were liberals living next door as if we would think that was bad thing. “They didn't like the sign in our yard.” Funny how easy it is to be so full of yourself that you think others would have to agree with you. You're on the right side of history after all. How could anyone not agree?
“When one part of America hurts, we all hurt.”
doesn't want to be wrong but the fact is they made a bad choice and our country is going to shit
intelligence of the rest of the _American people_. It's understandable that the so-called base
An odd example as if it was written by an angry misogynistic guy or something. I’m just saying...

Apparently _those people_ aren’t really people. They’re like monsters getting ready to invade our country and rape our children. That’s the crap Donald’s been feeding people and millions are eating it up. Our country’s in a bit of a mess right now. I regret I was speechless at the time.
Okay, so does that mean that when 65% of Americans are hurting about the state of our government,  the other ~35% are also hurting?
I want to deal with what’s possible, not wallow is what’s already taken place and left its ugly mark.

So this lady’s at our house a few weeks before Christmas and we’re talking. The conversation turns to her partner needing some rare medication that’s easier to get in Mexico. “We’re not sure about going to Mexico,” she says. “Okay, I know it’s a Trump thing and all but those caravan people are there.” Whoa!
Saying more about that now just adds to the noise, so let’s move on. My mind swirled a bit when I first read this at Anne’s place and I’m still thinkin’ about it:
- There are things I want to understand but never will and there are things I understand no one else would ever want to.
because of it being that way.

content: Be inquisitive. Know what you don't know.
Click on a post in the sidebar to view it. Click on a paragraph* to view related ideas.

Awakening. I don't agree..content: I want to deal with what’s possible, not wallow is what’s already taken place and left its ugly mark.
- There are things I want to understand but never will and there are things I understand no one else would ever want to.
- I don't know how many times I've tried to start this thing.
because of it being that way.

I’m convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I’m living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don’t see, to what might be.
The thing about repressed memories is that they never really go away.
Be inquisitive. Know what you don't know.
